bibl.seg: HARRIS W.V., A Revisionist View of Roman Money.

The Roman monetary system was far from relying entirely on coinage. Romans, especially those whose credit was good, frequently made payments without coinage. Credit-money added very significantly to the Roman Empire's money supply.
